alert.note: Alert for Sarpy (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 11 at 4:58PM CDT until June 11 at 5:30PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM CDT FOR WESTERN SARPY...SOUTHWESTERN DOUGLAS AND SOUTHEASTERN SAUNDERS COUNTIES... At 457 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles southwest of Gretna, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Public. At 454 PM quarter sized hail was reported in Mead. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of western Sarpy, southwestern Douglas and southeastern Saunders Counties, including the following locations... Memphis, Memphis State Recreation Area, Two Rivers State Recreation Area and Lake Wanahoo Recreation Area. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for southeastern and east central Nebraska. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
